sections.title: The challenge of finding the right candidate
sections.content:
Finding the perfect candidate in a vast pool of applicants can feel like searching for a needle in a haystack. Generic applicant tracking systems (ATS) often offer limited filtering capabilities, leading to manual sifting through irrelevant resumes, missed opportunities, and delayed hiring decisions. This inefficiency not only impacts productivity but also leads to hiring fatigue and poor candidate experience.

Off-the-shelf solutions are designed for broad appeal, not your unique recruitment workflows. They often lack the specific filters you need, force you into pre-defined categories, or charge exorbitant fees for custom fields. Imagine a filtering screen built exactly for your roles, your industry, and your evaluation criteria‚Äîthat's what Kliv empowers you to create.

sections.title: Why build a custom candidate filtering screen?
sections.content:
## The limitations of off-the-shelf ATS filters

Most Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) provide basic search and filter functions. However, they frequently fall short for organizations with specific talent needs:

- **Limited customization**: You're often stuck with pre-defined fields, unable to add specific skills, certifications, or cultural fit indicators that matter to your company.
- **Poor precision**: Broad keyword searches can return too many irrelevant results, while strict filters might exclude suitable candidates.
- **Lack of integration**: Data silos between your ATS, HRIS, and assessment tools make a holistic candidate view difficult.
- **Scalability issues**: As your hiring volume grows, inefficient filtering becomes a major bottleneck.
- **Costly features**: Advanced filtering or custom field capabilities often come with hefty premium price tags.

## The power of a tailored solution

Building a dedicated candidate filtering screen with Kliv puts you in control. Here's why it's a strategic move:

### Hyper-specific criteria
Define your filters beyond standard keywords. Include nuanced skills, project experience types, psychometric scores, or even alignment with company values. Your filters are truly yours.

### Intuitive user experience
Design a clean, recruiter-friendly interface that prioritizes the most important filters for your team. Reduce clicks and find candidates faster.

### Seamless data unification
Integrate data from multiple sources‚Äîyour ATS, assessment platforms, internal databases, or even external social profiles‚Äîinto one powerful, searchable view.

### Real-time insights
Combine filtering with analytics to understand your candidate pipeline better. Identify where strong candidates are coming from and where bottlenecks occur.

### Cost efficiency & ownership
A custom-built solution eliminates recurring subscription fees for inadequate tools. You own the asset, can modify it endlessly, and adapt it as your hiring strategy evolves.

## Real-world impact

Custom filtering solutions are transforming recruitment across industries:

**Tech Companies**: Quickly identify candidates with niche programming language experience, specific project methodologies (e.g., Agile, Scrum), and open-source contributions.

**Healthcare Systems**: Filter nurses by specific certifications (e.g., ACLS, PALS), patient demographics experience (e.g., pediatric, geriatric), or specialized unit experience (e.g., ICU, ER).

**Financial Services**: Locate candidates with specific regulatory compliance knowledge, financial modeling expertise, or experience with particular trading platforms.

**Manufacturing**: Screen for candidates with specific machinery operation licenses, lean manufacturing experience, or quality control certifications.

## AI-powered development for Recruiters

Building sophisticated tools used to require large development teams. Kliv's AI platform makes it accessible:

- **Natural Language Design**: Describe the filters and data points you need, and the AI helps construct the application.
- **Rapid Iteration**: Test out filter combinations and UI designs instantly, iterating until it's perfect.
- **Intelligent Data Linking**: AI assists in connecting disparate data sources, making complex queries simple.
- **Automated UI Generation**: Focus on *what* you want to filter, and the AI handles the interface layout.

Stop settling for 'good enough' when it comes to hiring. Build a filtering screen that gives your recruitment team a true competitive edge. With Kliv, precise talent identification is within reach.

sections.title: Candidate filtering ideas to get you started

items.description: Filter by years of experience, specific job titles, previous companies.
items.prompt: Create a filtering screen for job candidates that allows search by professional background, including years of experience, specific job titles, type of industry, and previous employers.
items.title: Professional Experience Filter

items.description: Search by specific technical skills, software proficiency, or industry-specific certifications.
items.prompt: Build a candidate filter that focuses on key technical skills, programming languages, software proficiencies, and industry certifications like PMP or AWS Certified Solutions Architect.
items.title: Skills & Certifications Filter

items.description: Narrow down candidates by degree, major, university reputation, and academic awards.
items.prompt: Develop a filtering screen for educational background, allowing recruiters to search by highest degree obtained, major, specific universities, and academic distinctions like Dean's List or honors.
items.title: Educational Background Filter

items.description: Filter by location, willingness to relocate, visa status, and preferred work model (remote/hybrid).
items.prompt: Design a candidate filtering tool that includes geographic preferences like city/state, willingness to relocate, current visa status, and preferred work model (remote, hybrid, on-site).
items.title: Location & Eligibility Filter

items.description: Include soft skills (e.g., communication, leadership) and cultural fit indicators.
items.prompt: Create a filter that evaluates candidates based on soft skills identified from assessments or previous notes, such as leadership potential, communication style, problem-solving approach, and cultural values alignment.
items.title: Soft Skills & Cultural Fit

items.description: Enable filtering by internal application stage, recruiter assigned, and candidate status.
items.prompt: Build a filtering interface specifically for internal recruitment process management, allowing filtering by current application stage, recruiter assigned, candidate status (e.g., 'on hold', 'rejected', 'interviewing'), and last interaction date.
items.title: Recruitment Workflow Status
